avalancheActivity.comment:
As a consequence of new snow and a gathering strong wind from northwesterly directions, large surface-area wind slabs will form in the course of the day especially above approximately 2000 m.
The near-surface layers of the snowpack can be released even by individual winter sport participants on wind-loaded slopes. Such avalanche prone locations are to be found also in places that are some distance from ridgelines and in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain above approximately 2200 m, caution is to be exercised in particular along the border with France and along the border with Switzerland.

Dry avalanches can be released in deep layers by large loads. These can reach quite a large size.
avalancheActivity.highlights: During the day: The strong wind will transport the fresh and old snow. The wind slabs can be released easily. or in isolated cases naturally,.

snowpackStructure.comment:
In some localities 5 to 15 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, will fall from the afternoon above approximately 2000 m. Until Tuesday the wind will be strong.
In particular at elevated altitudes snow depths vary greatly at elevated altitudes, depending on the infuence of the wind.
The upper section of the snowpack is unfavourably layered and its surface has a melt-freeze crust that is not capable of bearing a load, in particular below approximately 2100 m. Over a wide area various wind slab layers are lying on a hard crust.

tendency.comment: The danger will not decrease for the time being.

avalancheActivity.comment:
As a consequence of a gathering strong wind from northwesterly directions, wind slabs will form in the course of the day especially above approximately 2000 m.
The fresh wind slabs can be released by a single winter sport participant. In the regions neighbouring those that are subject to danger level 3 (considerable) the avalanche prone locations are more prevalent.
Such avalanche prone locations are to be found also in places that are some distance from ridgelines and in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain above approximately 2200 m.
avalancheActivity.highlights: During the day: The strong wind will transport the snow. The wind slabs represent the main danger.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Especially in the regions neighbouring those that are subject to danger level 3 (considerable) 5 to 10 cm of snow, but less in some localities, will fall from the afternoon above approximately 2000 m.
Until Tuesday the wind will be strong.
Snow depths vary greatly at high altitude, depending on the infuence of the wind. The upper section of the snowpack is unfavourably layered and its surface has a melt-freeze crust that is not capable of bearing a load, in particular below approximately 2100 m.
Over a wide area new snow and wind slabs are lying on a hard crust.
Especially on steep sunny slopes as well as below approximately 1900 m less snow than usual is lying. Also adjacent to ridgelines hardly any snow is lying.
